alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 29 at 8:13PM CDT until May 05 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Forks ND has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin affecting Clay County. .Water levels will begin to rise along the south branch of the Buffalo River in Sabin, reaching Minor Flood Stage May 1st. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON TO THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon to Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD STAGE. Flooding on road cut at old meander scar east of gage begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Friday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Sunday afternoon to a crest of 13.5 feet Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
